climbs.name: The Pit Works in Mysterious Ways

content.description: Squat start on the right side of the east face. Move up the right side of the triangle face, and top out at the apex. The hands are positive, and the feet are a little more technical.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. There is a small "pit" in the landing zone that was difficult to get a pad over, so you do want to be aware of that.
content.location: Sit start on the right side of the triangle. Top out at the apex. There is a downclimb on the east face.

content.description: Sit start in the middle of the east, triangular, face. Start with a left hand sidepull and right hand crimp. Using crimps and rails, top out at the apex of the triangle.
content.protection: Pads and spotters. There is a large right in the landing zone. Multiple pads were nice to have.
content.location: Sit start in the middle of the problem. Top out straight above you. There is a downclimb on the east face.

content.description: Sit start on the left side of the triangular south face. Move up the ramp of the triangle using positive holds and particular feet.
content.protection: Pads and spotters. The landing isn't perfect, but with a good spotter, it should be okay.
content.location: This climb is on the south face and starts on the left side of the triangle. There is an easy downclimb on the east side. Reference the pictures for exact information.

pathTokens: Gateway Vicinity aka The West End
